company.name: Fashion Nova, LLC
company.business_description: Fashion Nova specializes in fast fashion apparel designed and manufactured quickly and inexpensively to allow mainstream consumers to buy the latest fashion trends. The company sells Fashion Nova brand apparel primarily online through the fashionnova.com website, adding as many as 1,000 or more new clothing designs per week.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Fashion Nova, a fast fashion retailer, solicited product reviews from customers on its website and through emails. From late 2015 through mid-November 2019, the company used a third-party review management system configured to automatically post four- and five-star reviews while suppressing hundreds of thousands of lower-starred negative reviews without approval or publication. This resulted in product pages displaying only positive reviews that did not accurately reflect the views of all customers who submitted reviews.

representations_made.description: Product reviews on the Fashion Nova website accurately reflect the views of all purchasers who submitted reviews
representations_made.quoted_text: the product reviews on the Fashion Nova website accurately reflect the views of all purchasers who submitted reviews of Fashion Nova products to the website

counts.title: Deceptive Review Practices
counts.representation: The product reviews on the Fashion Nova website accurately reflect the views of all purchasers who submitted reviews of Fashion Nova products to the website
counts.fact: The product reviews on the Fashion Nova website did not accurately reflect the views of all purchasers who submitted reviews of the products because in numerous instances the Respondent suppressed product reviews with ratings lower than four stars
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 10 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: Fashion Nova, LLC, a limited liability company, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make any misrepresentations about product reviews or endorsements, including claims that reviews accurately reflect all purchaser views, are unedited, are presented regardless of opinion, or about how reviews factor into ratings.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that product reviews accurately reflect the views of all purchasers who submitted reviews
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent, and Respondent's officers, agents, employees; and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any ofthem, who receive actual notice ofthis Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, promotion, offering for sale, or sale ofany product must not make any misrepresentation, expressly or by implication, about product reviews or endorsements ofthe product, including any misrepresentation: A. That product reviews on Respondent's website accurately reflect the views ofall purchasers who submitted reviews ofRespondent's products on the website;

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that product reviews or endorsements are unedited
requirements.quoted_text: B. That product reviews or endorsements ofany products are unedited;

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent that product reviews or endorsements are presented regardless of the endorser's opinion or rating
requirements.quoted_text: C. That product reviews or endorsements ofany products are presented regardless ofthe endorser's opinion or rating;

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent how product reviews factor into any composite or overall rating of a product
requirements.quoted_text: D. About bow product reviews factor into any composite or overall rating ofa product.

provisions.title: Product Review Display
provisions.summary: Respondent must display all consumer-submitted reviews for products currently offered for sale, including previously withheld reviews, with specific exceptions for unrelated, unlawful, profane, obscene, or discriminatory content.

requirements.description: Must display all reviews for products currently offered for sale that are or were submitted by consumers, including previously withheld reviews
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must display, on each ofits websites disp1aying product reviews, all reviews for products currently offered for sale that are or were submitted by consumers to such website, including all reviews that Respondent or its agents previously withheld from public view. Provided that Respondent: (a) is not required to display reviews that are unrelated to Respondent's products and unrelated to Respondent's customer service, delivery, returns, or exchanges; (b) is not required to display reviews that contain unlawful, profane, obscene, vulgar, or sexually explicit content, or content that is inappropriate with respect to race, gender, sexuality, or ethnicity, so long as the criteria for withholding reviews is applied uniformly to all reviews submitted to such website; and (c) is not required to offer the opportunity to submit reviews for any or every product offered for sale on such website.

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $4,200,000 to the Commission as monetary relief within 8 days of the effective date of the Order.

requirements.description: Must pay $4,200,000 to the Commission as monetary relief
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent must pay to the Commission $4,200,000 as monetary relief.

requirements.description: Payment must be made within 8 days of the effective date by electronic fund transfer
requirements.quoted_text: B. Such payment must be made within 8 days ofthe effective date ofthis Order by electronic fund transfer in accordance with instructions provided by a representative of the Commission.

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, and the order establishes facts for bankruptcy and collection enforcement purposes, with provisions for default interest and civil penalties.

requirements.description: Respondent relinquishes all rights to transferred assets and may not seek their return
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent relinquishes dominion and all legal and equitable right, title, and interest in all assets transferred pw-suant to this Order and may not seek the return ofany assets.

requirements.description: Facts alleged in the Complaint will be taken as true in subsequent civil litigation to enforce payment
requirements.quoted_text: B. The facts alleged in the Complaint will be taken as true, without further proof, in any subsequent civil litigation by or on behalfofthe Commission to enforce its rights to any payment pursuant to this Order, such as a nondischargeability complaint in any bankruptcy case.

requirements.description: Facts establish elements for bankruptcy nondischargeability under 11 U.S.C. § 523(a)(2)(A)
requirements.quoted_text: C. The facts alleged in the Complaint establish all elements necessary to sustain an action by or on behalfofthe Commission pursuant to Section 523(a)(2)(A) ofthe Bankruptcy Code, 11 U.S.C. § 523(a)(2)(A), and this Order will have collateral estoppel effect for such purposes.

requirements.description: Money paid may be used for consumer redress or other relief as determined by the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: D. All money paid to the Commission pursuant to this Order may be deposited into a fund administered by the Commission or its designee to be used for relief, including consumer redress and any attendant expenses for the administration ofany redress fund. Ifa representative ofthe Commission decides that direct redress to consumers is wholly or partially impracticable or money remains after redress is completed, the Commission may apply any remaining money for such other relief (including consumer information remedies) as it determines to be reasonably related to Respondent's practices alleged in the Complaint. Any money not used is to be deposited to the U.S. Treasury. Respondent has no right to challenge any activities pursuant to this Provision.

requirements.description: Interest accrues on default payments, and entire amount becomes due if default continues for 10 days
requirements.quoted_text: E. In the event ofdefault on any obligation to make payment under this Order, interest, computed as ifpursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1961(a), shall accrue .from the date ofdefault to the date ofpayment. In the event such default continues for 10 days beyond the date that payment is due, the entire amount will immediately become due and payable.

requirements.description: Each day of nonpayment constitutes a separate violation subject to civil penalties
requirements.quoted_text: F. Each day ofnonpayment is a violation through continuing failure to obey or neglect to obey a final order ofthe Commission and thus will be deemed a separate offense and violation for which a civil penalty shall accrue.

requirements.description: Taxpayer Identification Number may be used for collecting delinquent amounts
requirements.quoted_text: G. Respondent acknowledges that its Taxpayer Identification Number (Employer Identification Number), which Respondent has previously submitted to the Commission, may be used for collecting and reporting on any delinquent amount arising out ofthis Order, in accordance with 31 U.S.C. § 7701.

Delivery must occur within 10 days after the effective date ofthis Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Must obtain signed and dated acknowledgments of receipt from each individual or entity that received a copy

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specific records for designated periods, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance records, marketing materials, and product reviews.

requirements.description: Must create accounting records for 10 years and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must create certain records for 10 years after the issuance date ofthe Order, and retain each such record for 5 years, unless otherwise specified below. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: A. Accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold, the costs incurred in generating those revenues, and resulting net profit or loss;

requirements.description: Must create personnel records for 10 years and retain each for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: B. Personnel records showing, for each person providing services in relation to any aspect of the Order, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person's: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates ofservice; and (ifapplicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Must create and retain copies of all consumer complaints relating to customer reviews
requirements.quoted_text: C. Copies or records ofall consumer or other complaints relating to customer reviews, whether received directly or indirectly, such as through a third party, and any response;

requirements.description: Must create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision
requirements.quoted_text: D. All records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision ofthis Order, including all submissions to the Commission;

requirements.description: Must create and retain copies of each unique advertisement or marketing material and each product review submitted
requirements.quoted_text: E. A copy ofeach unique advertisement or other marketing material making a representation subject to this Order and a copy ofeach product review submitted to Respondent;

requirements.description: Must retain for 5 years all records showing any lack of compliance with the Order
requirements.quoted_text: F. For 5 years from the date created or received, all records, whether prepared by or on behalfofRespondent, that tend to show any lack ofcompliance by Respondent with this Order.

Respondent must pe1mit representatives ofthe Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is final and effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates 20 years from issuance or from the most recent federal court complaint filing, with specific provisions for complaint dismissal or ruling.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon publication on ftc.gov
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date ofits publication on the Commission's website (fie.gov) as a final order.

requirements.description: Order terminates 20 years from issuance or from most recent federal court complaint filing, whichever is later
requirements.quoted_text: This Order will terminate 20 years from the date ofits issuance (which date may be stated at the end ofthis Order, near the Commission's seal), or 20 years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation ofthis Order, whichever comes later;provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A.
